Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan have won eight of the last nine ODIs against Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka have never beaten Pakistan in the 50-over World Cup.
Pakistan's middle order has suddenly sprung to life.
Haris Rauf showed he was back to his best, finding wickets through that period and blasting batting line-ups wide open.
Sri Lanka's bowling attack was taken apart by South Africa in their tournament opener in Delhi.
The pitch in Hyderabad has been batting-friendly so far in the World Cup.
Sri Lanka will likely return to their previous form and take advantage of the vulnerability of Pakistan's top order.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The skies will be partly cloudy during the Pakistan vs Sri Lanka match in Hyderabad.
The chances of rainfall during the match are close to 0%
The temperature is expected to be 27 degrees Celsius
Pakistan's head coach Grant Bradburn has insisted that the form of the fast bowlers has overshadowed the improved performances of their middle order.
Sri Lanka's assistant coach Naveed Nawaz expects it to be a good tussle.
Grant Bradburn of New Zealand's head coach says Pakistan's top order will click at some stage.
